Responsibilities: Greetings to all customers and address their inquiries and complaints. Maintain cleanliness and safety of the outlet. Monitor product stock and assist the showroom manager in preparing a demand requisition to be submitted to the Area Manager. Build relationships with clients by providing product information, suggesting new products, and implementing service improvements. Receive and inspect products from suppliers and affix product barcodes. Assist the showroom manager in preparing the daily sales report to be sent to the Area Manager. Open and close the showroom on time and ensure all electricity is turned off at closing.

Greetings, every customer, and respond to their inquiries and complaints. Maintain the outletтАЩs cleanliness and safety. Check the productтАЩs stock and assist the showroom manager in preparing a demand requisition for submitting it to the Area manager. Maintain a relationship with clients by providing product information, recommending new products, and making service improvements. Receive and check products from suppliers and attach the productтАЩs barcode. Assist the showroom manager in preparing the daily sales report for sending it to the Area Manager. Responsibilities: Team Leader:
1. Provide maximum cooperation to the team leader in all tasks.
2. Manage and complete assigned tasks of fiber team members in the absence of the team leader.
3. Perform tasks such as fiber splicing, dressing fiber boxes, OTDR testing, power checking, router configuration, etc.
4. Provide utmost support to the team leader to efficiently complete assigned tasks using one's own skills as needed by the company.
5. Teach all team members necessary tasks so that the team can complete their assigned tasks efficiently in the absence of any member.
6. Ensure the quality of work.
7. Adhere to office rules and regulations and foster the same mentality among other team members.
8. Work for the company in case of any emergency.
9. Share necessary information and images with the Head Office Co-ordinator for each task. Also, provide reports on the team's used and remaining inventory and provide adequate support.
10. Ensure that each fiber technician is provided with designated and supplied attire, helmet, shoes, belt, and gloves for work convenience and safety.

Minimum Qualifications and Experience:
1. Must be able to read and pronounce English writing.
2. Must have at least 1 year of experience working as a co-team leader or leading a team.
3. Must have experience working with splicing machines, OTDR, power meters, splitters, ONUs, MCIs, modulars, fibers, Wi-Fi routers, etc.
4. Must be able to communicate, take photos, and share on a smartphone.
5. Priority will be given to those who have passed SSC/HSC.
6. Must be hardworking and honest.

Job Type:
Full-time

9 hours

Day shift

- Tour Allowance

- Partially Subsidized Lunch Facilities
